snippet: New York often resorts to revenue-raising expedients like a lucrative new campaign to keep drivers on Broadway below Houston Street from venturing into the bus lane.
abstract: Jim Dwyer About New York column holds that while Mayor Michael R Bloomberg's budget proposal does not raise taxes for the city's residents, no mayor has been able to resist the lure of raising revenue through traffic fines, and Bloomberg is no exception.
lead_paragraph: New York often resorts to revenue-raising expedients like a lucrative new campaign to keep drivers on Broadway below Houston Street from venturing into the bus lane.

headline.seo: Tickets Are Partners of Taxes in City Budget
headline.main: In City Finances, a Subtle Star, Uncredited
headline.print_headline: As Fiscal Cloud Lifts, Mayor Offers a Budget Free of Tax Increases or Broad Layoffs: In City Finances, A Subtle Star, Uncredited
